title: Campus safety in focus: Law college gangrape triggers RG Kar case memories; Kolkata reels in shock
content: A 24-year-old law student in Kolkata was allegedly gang-raped on her college campus by an ex-student leader and two junior students. The survivor reported the assault occurred after she rejected a marriage proposal, leading to her abduction and sexual assault in a security room.

title: Rescheduling chaos: Flyer says family split across 3 flights; 'had to change all plans'
content: Air India passengers are facing significant disruptions due to flight cancellations and schedule changes. Anish Agarwal's family's Toronto-Pune trip was split across multiple days, while a Pune family's Mumbai-Newark flight was abruptly cancelled, leading to re-routing. These issues stem from fleet reductions, causing international travelers to experience delays, extended layovers, and lack of compensation, sparking widespread frustration.

title: Puri Jagannath Rath Yatra: 750 fall ill from heat and crowding; 12 in ICU
content: During the Rath Yatra in Puri, approximately 750 devotees were hospitalized due to exhaustion and crowd pressure. Health officials reported that over 230 individuals were admitted to the Infectious Disease Hospital, while around 520 received treatment at the district headquarters hospital.

title: ‚ÄòNazi Ancestor Pass‚Äô: Derek O‚ÄôBrien targets Election Commission over NRC
content: Derek O'Brien and Asaduddin Owaisi have strongly criticized the Election Commission of India's voter verification drive in Bihar and West Bengal. They allege it's a disguised attempt to implement the NRC, potentially disenfranchising many, especially the poor.

title: Iran buries top military commanders killed in Israel war; thousands join in funeral
content: Iran held a state funeral in Tehran for approximately 60 individuals, including military commanders and 14 nuclear scientists, who died in the conflict with Israel. The ceremony commenced in Islamic Revolution Square, attended by government officials and mourners waving Iranian flags. Among the deceased were Major General Mohammad Bagheri and nuclear scientist Mohammad Mehdi Tehranchi, both to be buried alongside their families.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are ‚Ä¶
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: $30bn for Iran nuclear program? 'Ridiculous idea', says Trump; dismisses report
content: Donald Trump has vehemently denied reports suggesting his administration considered a $30 billion deal to aid Iran in developing a civil nuclear program. He dismissed the reports as "fake news" and a "hoax" intended to demean him.

title: Online dating app turns costly: 63-yr-old Bengal man duped of Rs 66.6 lakh
content: A 63-year-old Salt Lake resident was swindled out of Rs 66.6 lakh in an online investment scam after connecting with a woman on a dating app. The woman persuaded him to invest, promising high returns, and added him to a Telegram group.

title: US immigration authority to Visa applicants: Effective July 1, 2025, USCIS will no longer send ...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: Gurgaon shocker: 29-year-old MNC executive found dead; cops quiz boyfriend
content: Gurgaon police are investigating the death of a 29-year-old woman found in her DLF-3 apartment after a foul smell was reported. The woman, an orphan from Najafgarh, Delhi, was reportedly in a seven-year relationship with a man who last saw her on Monday.

title: Mid-air depressurisation: Mumbai-bound flight makes emergency landing; 7 ill
content: An Ethiopian Airlines flight, ET640, en route to Mumbai from Addis Ababa, made an emergency landing early Friday due to cabin depressurization. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner was over the Arabian Sea when the incident occurred, prompting a rapid descent. Upon landing, medical personnel attended to seven passengers experiencing decompression-related symptoms, with one requiring hospitalization.

title: 'Want to unveil real face': Bengal woman accuses Padma Shri awardee of rape
content: A woman filed a police complaint against Padma Shri awardee Swami Pradiptanandaji. She alleged repeated rape at Bharat Sevashram Sangha in Murshidabad. The woman claimed she was promised a teaching job. She further stated she was forced to undergo an abortion. BJP leaders are calling it a conspiracy. Trinamool Congress demands a thorough investigation.

title: SoftBank founder‚Äôs prediction: Bets billions on AI company; predicts it will lead world
content: SoftBank is heavily investing in OpenAI, with planned investments of $33.2 billion, as CEO Masayoshi Son envisions OpenAI becoming the world's most valuable company and a leader in artificial superintelligence. Despite Microsoft's changing relationship with OpenAI, SoftBank remains committed to supporting the AI firm's growth and its role in SoftBank's vision for the future.

title: Vande Bharat train scuffle: BJP MLA denies role; says 'passenger provoked me'
content: Babina MLA Rajeev Singh Parichha addressed the Vande Bharat Express assault, denying direct involvement but admitting his security guard summoned people fearing a further altercation after a seat exchange dispute. He claims he tried to stop the attack and has asked the GRP to take action.

title: 'Humbly accept it as prasad': PM Modi honoured as 'Dharma Chakravarti'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the ‚ÄòDharma Chakravarti‚Äô title at  Vidyanand's centenary. The event took place at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi. It marked the start of a year-long tribute. Vidyanand's contributions were showcased. He designed the Jain Flag and Emblem. The centenary will feature cultural, literary, and spiritual programs.

title: Kolkata law student rape case: College security guard held; 4th arrest made
content: West Bengal Police have arrested a fourth individual in connection with the alleged gang-rape of a law student at a Kolkata college. The survivor, from South 24 Parganas, reported being sexually assaulted in the college's security guards' room after being offered a student union post. Manojit Mishra, a former student, along with Pramit Mukherjee and Zaib Ahmed, were previously arrested.

title: Yemen launches barrage of missiles; Israel says 'most likely intercepted'
content: The Israeli army reported detecting a missile launch from Yemen aimed at Israeli territory, triggering sirens in southern Israel. Israel's aerial defense systems were activated to intercept the incoming projectile. The IDF communicated the urgent situation via Telegram, emphasizing ongoing efforts to neutralize the threat and protect civilians.

title: Birthright citizenship: US limits nationwide injunctions ‚Äì what it means for immigrants
content: The US Supreme Court limited lower courts' power to issue nationwide injunctions, impacting immigration law. This allows President Trump's order ending birthright citizenship for children of undocumented immigrants to take effect in 28 states. While the policy remains blocked in 22 states, immigrant rights groups fear legal confusion and potential statelessness for newborns.

title: France bans outdoor smoking: Parks, beaches, schools included
content: France is set to implement a smoking ban in various public spaces starting Sunday, including beaches, parks, and bus shelters. The new decree aims to protect children from passive smoking, extending the prohibition to areas outside schools and swimming pools. Violators will face a fine of 135 euros.

title: Neeraj Chopra thinks this cricketer could dominate javelin too- Watch
content: Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra believes Jasprit Bumrah possesses the fitness and strength to excel in javelin throw, highlighting the crossover of athletic abilities. Bumrah's impressive 2024 performance includes 78 wickets in 15 Test matches, leading all fast bowlers globally in wickets and overs bowled.

title: 'Tufano ko ... ': Suryavanshi's Bollywood-inspired post after 5 sixes
content: India's Under-19 team showcased their dominance by defeating England in the first Youth ODI with a six-wicket victory. Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old debutant, stole the show with a rapid 48 off 19 balls. Abhigyan Kundu's anchored innings ensured a comfortable chase, complementing the bowlers' effort in restricting England to 174.

title: In 24 hrs: Trump's 'no trade barrier' pitch for India; signs China deal, snubs Canada
content: President Trump is aggressively reshaping US trade policy, initiating swift actions against Canada over its digital services tax by halting trade talks and threatening tariffs. Simultaneously, he's pursuing a significant trade agreement with India, aiming to dismantle existing barriers. A confirmed deal with China, focused on rare earth minerals, signals a broader strategy to assert American dominance in global commerce.

title: CBSE board exams twice a year: Why it matters; expert tips to maximize both attempts
content: Starting in 2025, CBSE is introducing a twice-a-year board exam model for Class 10, aligning with NEP 2020. This initiative aims to reduce student stress by offering a second chance to improve scores. Students can strategically use both sessions to enhance their performance and balance board preparation with entrance exam studies.

title: Axiom-4: Crew settles in, Shubhanshu Shukla will sleep in 'Dragon'
content: Following their arrival at the International Space Station, the Axiom-4 crew, including Peggy Whitson, is being assisted by Expedition 73 in acclimating to the orbital environment and preparing for microgravity research. The crews are collaborating on unloading cargo, reviewing safety protocols, and familiarizing themselves with station systems. Expedition 73 is maintaining its research schedule while supporting the Axiom-4 mission.

title: Kolkata gangrape case: RG Kar victim's father slams TMC; says 'govt has a significant role'
content: A female law student was allegedly gang-raped inside her college in South Kolkata's Kasba area, sparking outrage and raising concerns about women's safety. Following the incident, police swiftly arrested three individuals, identified as former students or staff of the college. The arrests occurred within 12 hours of the complaint, prompting political reactions and demands for strict punishment.

title: CJI Gavai reflects on early struggles; gets emotional
content: Chief Justice of India, Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai, shared his personal journey at a Nagpur event, recalling his family's sacrifices and his father's dream of him becoming a lawyer dedicated to social good, inspired by Dr. BR Ambedkar. Gavai, who initially wanted to be an architect, also humorously recounted a cheque bounce case involving actor Hema Malini.

title: Love, faith, & vegetarian life: Usha Vance opens up on life as US second lady
content: Second Lady Usha Vance offers a glimpse into her interfaith marriage with Vice President J.D. Vance, highlighting their open conversations about faith and cultural traditions. She shares how they navigate raising their children in a Catholic school while ensuring they have access to Hindu culture through family and travel. Usha also discusses her vegetarian upbringing and J.D.'s culinary experiments.

title: 'Live-ins clash with values': HC on bail plea in rape-on-marriage-pledge case
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to Shane Alam, accused of sexual exploitation. The court observed live-in relationships clash with Indian middle-class values. Justice Siddharth's bench expressed concern over rising cases related to live-in arrangements. The court noted women often face difficulties after such relationships end. Alam was booked under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and the Pocso Act.

title: 'He didn‚Äôt let me go': Kolkata law student gangraped after rejecting proposal
content: A law student in Kolkata was allegedly gang-raped in her college's security room after being lured with the promise of a key union post. Police have arrested three individuals, including a college alumnus and two current students, following the survivor's complaint and medical corroboration.

title: 'Aircraft malfunction': Chinese domestic flight makes emergency landing in Nanjing
content: Shandong Airlines flight SC4667, traveling from Qingdao to Shanghai, made an emergency landing in Nanjing due to a reported burning odor and suspected engine malfunction. Passengers described feeling terrified as the plane shook, but praised the crew's handling of the situation and the pilot's smooth landing. The airline ensured all passengers were accommodated and arranged for a replacement aircraft.

title: Prada bows! Italian brand forced to credit Kolhapuri designs; legal options being mulled
content: Prada's 2026 menswear line, featuring sandals resembling Kolhapuri chappals, has sparked controversy in India over cultural appropriation. While Prada acknowledges the design's inspiration and commits to engaging with Indian artisans, LIDCOM is considering legal action due to the lack of credit and potential GI violation.

title: 'Had no choice but to run to daddy': Iran's sharp jibe at Israel
content: Iranian foreign minister Araghchi urged Donald Trump to retract his "disrespectful" remarks about Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, emphasizing that such rhetoric hinders potential nuclear deal negotiations. Araghchi's statement follows recent tensions, including Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear sites and retaliatory missile launches.

title: Rohit Sharma takes a break, spotted vacationing in Milan with wife Ritika
content: Amidst India's struggle against England in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, former captain Rohit Sharma's Milan vacation sparked debate. Shubman Gill, succeeding Sharma, faced criticism after a defeat at Headingley. Despite centuries from multiple Indian batsmen, batting collapses and dropped catches led to England's victory. Nasser Hussain pointed out Gill's reactive captaincy, contrasting it with Sharma and Kohli's proactive leadership.

title: Ghana, Argentina, Brazil & more: PM Modi on 5-nation tour; what's on agenda?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will soon be embarking on a significant multi-nation tour from July 2-9, aimed at strengthening India's global partnerships. He will visit Ghana, Trinidad & Tobago, Argentina, Brazil for the BRICS summit, and Namibia. These visits aim to enhance bilateral relations, focusing on economic, energy, defense, and trade collaborations.

title: 'No excuses left' ‚Äì Former India cricketer turns up the heat on Gambhir
content: Gautam Gambhir, India's head coach, faces increasing scrutiny after the team's struggles in Test cricket, highlighted by a recent defeat to England under Shubman Gill's captaincy. With only one win in the last nine Tests, including series losses to New Zealand and Australia, pressure mounts. Aakash Chopra emphasizes the need for results, noting the selectors' support.

title: 20 years after split, Uddhav & Raj join hands to oppose 'Hindi imposition' in Maha
content: Uddhav and Raj Thackeray are set to unite for a joint protest march on July 5 against the alleged imposition of Hindi in Maharashtra schools. This marks their first political collaboration in two decades, sparking speculation of a potential reunion for upcoming civic polls.

title: Angel Reese sends message to brother Julian after Lakers deal; reminds him, ‚ÄòTime to work‚Äô
content: Julian Reese, brother of Angel Reese, is now with the Los Angeles Lakers. The Lakers signed the former Maryland Terrapins player. Angel Reese expressed her joy and support on social media. She reminded Julian that the real work is just beginning. Julian Reese had a successful college career. He aims to make a mark in the NBA.

title: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez tie the knot! First wedding pic out; big names in attendance
content: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez celebrated their marriage in a lavish ceremony in Venice, Italy, attended by numerous celebrities. The celebrations, however, sparked controversy as activists protested the environmental impact and the city's struggles with tourism and rising costs. While the wedding is expected to generate significant revenue for Venice, concerns remain about its long-term sustainability.

title: As India chase series equaliser, record at Edgbaston is cause for concern
content: India faces a daunting challenge at Edgbaston, a venue where they've never won a Test match. After a painful defeat at Headingley, where England chased down a substantial target, India is under pressure to avoid a series loss. Breaking the Edgbaston jinx, dating back to 1967, requires an extraordinary effort against a confident England team.

title: ‚ÄòWorst-dressed couple‚Äô: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce mocked for NYC date-night look
content: Teilor Swift's recent date night outfit with Travis Kelce sparked online criticism. Her powder-blue corset top and Miu Miu mini skirt drew disapproval from fans. Critics questioned her fashion sense and styling choices. Some even suggested she needs a new stylist. This isn't the first time Swift's fashion choices have faced scrutiny.

title: Shefali Jariwala no more: Bigg Boss 13 star dies of cardiac arrest; actress was 42
content: In a devastating turn of events, actress Shefali Jariwala, recognized for her participation in Bigg Boss 13, has tragically died at the age of 42. She reportedly suffered a cardiac arrest on June 27th, as confirmed by a hospital receptionist.

title: Mazagon Dock's Lanka deal to give India big foothold in region
content: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited is set to acquire a controlling stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC for $53 million, marking its first international acquisition and providing a strategic foothold in the Indian Ocean Region. This move aims to counter China's growing influence in Sri Lanka and establish MDL as a global maritime player.

title: Orphaned in bus crash, 10-year-old asks God, 'what was our fault?'
content: A ten-year-old boy, Parth Soni, lost his parents in a bus accident near Gholtir in Rudraprayag district. The bus, carrying pilgrims, collided with a truck. Four people died, and others are missing. Parth, in shock, questioned Lord Badrinath. Rescue efforts are difficult due to terrain and currents. The bodies of Vishal and Gauri Soni will reach Rajgarh for final rites.

title: 'Shubman Gill didn't have Virat Kohli's aura': India captain slammed
content: England defeated India by five wickets in the first Test at Headingley, chasing down a target of 371, with Ben Duckett scoring a remarkable 149. Shubman Gill's captaincy debut faced scrutiny from former captains Nasser Hussain and Ravi Shastri, who questioned his on-field leadership and tactical decisions.

title: NHL draft tracker: Schaefer selected at No. 1, Misa goes No. 2 and more as Flames close out Round 1
content: Here is a list of every selection, including detailed analysis for the top 32 picks from Friday night at the NHL draft.

title: Sources: Wolves' Reid to sign 5-year, $125M deal
content: Naz Reid intends to sign a five-year, $125 million contract to remain with the Timberwolves, sources told ESPN.

title: Schaefer goes No. 1 to Isles; Misa, Frondell follow
content: The Islanders selected gifted defenseman Matthew Schaefer, 17, with the No. 1 pick in the NHL draft Friday night. Center Michael Misa went second to the Sharks, and the Blackhawks took Swedish forward Anton Frondell third.

title: Panthers keep playoff MVP Bennett on 8-year deal
content: The Panthers signed Conn Smythe winner Sam Bennett to an eight-year extension worth $64 million on Friday night, hours before the start of the NHL draft.

title: Martinez's near no-hitter, Steer's 3 HRs lift Reds
content: Nick Martinez took a no-hit bid into the ninth inning before allowing pinch-hitter Elias Diaz's double and Spencer Steer hit three home runs, leading the Reds over the Padres 8-1 on Friday night.

title: Bailey to report to Jazz on Saturday, team says
content: Ace Bailey, the No. 5 pick in the NBA draft Wednesday, plans to report to the Utah Jazz as expected Saturday, a team representative told ESPN on Friday.

title: Marte says fan shouted he messaged late mother
content: Diamondbacks second baseman Ketel Marte said a fan in Chicago who brought him to tears during a game against the White Sox this week shouted that he messaged his late mother the previous night.

title: BYU QB Retzlaff denies woman's rape allegations
content: BYU quarterback Jake Retzlaff responded to a woman's allegations that he raped, strangled and bit her in 2023, calling them "ridiculous and bizarre."

title: Flagg: 'Blessing' not being Mavs' centerpiece
content: Cooper Flagg called it a "blessing" to be the rare No. 1 overall pick who isn't the centerpiece of a rebuilding franchise, landing instead on a Dallas Mavericks roster loaded with veterans, including a few future Hall of Famers.

title: üíç Ravens' safety proposes to longtime girlfriend
content: The Baltimore Ravens safety and Reese Damm, his now-fianc√©e, have been dating since high school and announced their engagement via a shared Instagram post.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Early 2026 NBA mock draft: Meet the four contenders for the No. 1 pick
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: The NFL's most team- and player-friendly contracts at six positions: Who makes the list?
content: We picked out deals that favor the team's salary cap (Sam Darnold) and deals that favor the player's bank account (Jaycee Horn) at key positions.

content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: Kupcho, Maguire shoot best-ball 60, lead Dow
content: Jennifer Kupcho and Leona Maguire shot a 10-under 60 in better-ball play Friday to take the second-round lead in the Dow Championship, the LPGA Tour's only team event.

title: Will the USMNT's star absentees hurt their hopes for the 2026 World Cup?
content: Christian Pulisic, Weston McKennie, Antonee Robinson, Sergi√±o Dest: the U.S. has none of them at the Gold Cup. Is that damaging to their World Cup prep?

title: 5 questions the USMNT must answer in Gold Cup knockouts (and before 2026 World Cup)
content: The USMNT finished the group stage without a loss, and yet no one seems particularly comforted by that.

title: Sources: Brentford reject Man Utd's Mbeumo bid
content: Brentford have rejected an overall package worth ¬£62.5 million ($85.7 million) for Bryan Mbeumo from Manchester United, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: USMNT's Agyemang close to Derby move
content: Charlotte FC and USMNT striker Patrick Agyemang is closing in on a transfer to Derby County for a fee of $7 million, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Spain's Bonmati hospitalized with viral meningitis
content: Two-time Ballon d'Or winner and Spain national team star Aitana Bonmat√≠ has been hospitalized with viral meningitis just six days before the start of the Euro 2025.

title: Man City favored ahead of PSG in CWC betting
content: Manchester City is the +275 favorite to win the Club World Cup, according to ESPN BET odds, but they've been far from a popular selection.

title: Sources: USMNT's Weah rejects Forest deal
content: Nottingham Forest have ended their interest in Tim Weah after the United States striker rejected the club's contract proposal, sources told ESPN.

title: Guardiola: Grealish omission not due to behavior
content: Pep Guardiola has rejected the suggestion that Jack Grealish's omission from the Manchester City squad has anything to do with his off-field behaviour.

title: Sources: Giroud to join Lille as LAFC confirms exit
content: Olivier Giroud will join French club Lille this summer, sources have told ESPN, after LAFC confirmed it had agreed to terminate the French striker's contract.

title: Liverpool sign goalkeeper Woodman from Preston
content: Liverpool have agreed a deal to sign goalkeeper Freddie Woodman when his contract with Preston North End expires on June 30.

title: Wimbledon odds: Sabalenka, Alcaraz favorites to win
content: We're tracking the odds all the way through Wimbledon, where Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz are the betting favorites to win.

content: The Club World Cup group stage is complete and the knockouts begin this Saturday. So let's review the good and bad of the tournament so far, and make some picks for who wins it all on July 13.

content: Describing Sitaram Yechury as a Marxist with a keen interest in multiple subjects, CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby said he always tried to gain an in-depth knowledge in all of them

title: Police attacked, vehicles damaged during drug party raid in Kerala‚Äôs Thrissur
content: The first patrol team that arrived was ambushed by the gang hiding nearby. Subsequently, two more police vehicles were also attacked

title: Watch: In conversation with award-winning chef Vijay Kumar, of ‚ÄòSemma‚Äô, New York
content: Set in the heart of Manhattan, Semma is the first Indian restaurant to top the New York Times‚Äô 100 best restaurants list

content: A Government Resolution stated that Gondia, Salekasa, Devri and Arjuni Morgaon taluks in Gondia district and the entire Gadchiroli district are ‚ÄòNaxal-infested‚Äô

content: ‚ÄòThis move will benefit patients from North Karnataka seeking medical care in Mangaluru, students pursuing education in coastal districts and regular passengers,‚Äô says Dakshina Kannada MP Brijesh Chowta

title: Newly-elected MLA from Ludhiana West Sanjeev Arora administered oath by Punjab Vidhan Sabha Speaker
content: Arora had defeated Congress candidate Bharat Bhushan Ashu by a margin of 10,637 votes in the Ludhiana West Assembly bypoll

content: Major safety protocol breached in train operation on Tuesday;  Action in split seconds helped saving life of hundreds of passengers

content: Congress cadres from Srikakulam led by district president Ambati Krishna Rao  participate in Samvidhan Bachao Abhiyan

title: Zumba in schools: Government will not backout, says Sivankutty
content: The children will not be wearing skimpy clothes, but their school uniforms; this opposition will only benefit majority communalism in the state

title: Kolkata gang-rape case | Security guard of law college arrested
content: In her police complaint, the survivor alleged that the guard saw the incident unfold but did not act, instead vacating his room for the crime at the instruction of the main accused¬†

title: Breakthrough in M.M. Hills tiger deaths: three key accused arrested
content: The officials said based on credible information, five persons were taken into custody and interrogated following which it transpired that the three were directly involved in poisoning the tigers

title: Modi lauds former PM P.V. Narasimha Rao for ‚Äòeffective leadership‚Äô in crucial phase
content: ‚ÄòHis intellect, wisdom and scholarly nature are also widely admired,‚Äô posted PM Modi on X on former PM Narasimha Rao‚Äôs birth anniverary

title: Centre issues draft rules to ease tree felling on agricultural land, boost agroforestry
content: The new model rules seek to incentivise farmers to integrate trees into their farming systems without facing undue procedural hurdles.

title: Kolkata college student rape case: Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee‚Äôs comments spark outrage
content: ‚ÄúIf a friend rapes another friend, then how will the government authorities provide protection in such cases? Do you want to deploy police in educational institutions? Police cannot be in every corner,‚Äù Kalyan Banerjee said

title: Prada finally acknowledges Kolhapuri chappals inspiration for footwear in fashion show
content: The Italian house, however, said that sandals featured in the men‚Äôs 2026 fashion show are still at the design stage and none of the pieces worn by models on the ramp are confirmed to be commercialised

title: Chennai police constable clings to moving car while chasing absconding accused
content: The accused, however, escaped after pushing the constable off the vehicle; he sustained minor injuries

title: Air India venture sacks four employees over viral celebration video
content: Air India SATS said in a statement that company ‚Äúdeeply regrets the lapse in judgment reflected in a recent internal video‚Äù that was reportedly shot days after the Ahmedabad plane crash

title: Rath Yatra: Devotees resume pulling chariots in Puri
content: Amid chanting of ‚ÄòJai Jagannath‚Äô, the chariot pulling began again on Saturday, after conducting the morning rituals.

title: Bihar municipal election: First State using mobile phones for voting, says State Election Commissioner Deepak Prasad
content: e-Voting facilities are available in the ongoing municipal election for those people who are unable to go to polling booths to cast their votes

title: Chepauk Super Gillies‚Äô owner moves Madras High Court against TNOGA notice on online gaming ‚Äòendorsement‚Äô
content: The Tamil Nadu Online Gaming Authority had accused it of promoting online gambling through jersey branding and warned of penal action

title: NCW takes suo motu cognisance of sexual harassment of intern on IIT Madras campus¬†
content: NCW Chairperson Vijay Rahatkar has written to the Director General of Police, Tamil Nadu, seeking a fair and time-bound investigation under relevant provisions of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023

title: Shivamogga police arrest associate professor of SIMS on charges of sexual harassment
content: A postgraduate student, on June 20, filed a complaint with Shivamogga Women Police, accusing Ashwin Hebbar of sexual harrassment at a dinner party in a hotel.

title: India imposes land and sea port restrictions on jute from Bangladesh
content: Official sources informed that¬†the port restrictions on ‚Äújute and allied fibre/products from Bangladesh‚Äù has been implemented with immediate effect

title: Uneconomical, impractical: Experts on Railway‚Äôs decision to cap passenger waiting list at 25%
content: Railways Ministry has justified the decision, saying less than one-fourth of the total number of waiting passengers get confirmed berths on an average and the 25% cap has been placed in view of that

title: A day after BJP announces Tripura schedule, internal polls halted over differences

title: Kuppadam sarees: a woven tale of innovation, elegance and tradition
content: Borrowing its name from a complex weaving technique invented by weavers over 150 years ago, Kuppadam saree is a cultural icon in Andhra Pradesh. With its exquisite details, these woven wonder of silk and cotton blend art and heritage on every warp and weft

title: Grading the Celtics' flurry of trades, plus every deal during the NBA draft
content: the trade window kicked off when the Memphis Grizzlies agreed to trade guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony . on Sunday, the most highly anticipated offseason trade took place as the Phoenix Suns forward and former MVP Kevin Durant was traded to the Houston Rockets . Jrue Holiday also was traded from the Boston Celtics to the Portland Trail Blazers on Monday for guard Anfernee Simons and two future second-round picks.
